data.title: Still the best pho
data.text:
This restaurant is still the best pho in Alameda, maybe even in the East Bay. Alameda has no shortage of Vietnamese restaurants. But if you're interested in fantastic pho you definitely need to eat here.

You can't beat the freshness, and the flavor of the broth. I always order mine with extra vegetables and it comes chalked full of fresh broccoli and bok choy. The chicken is tender white meat. Service is good and friendly. Price is Right.

data.title: Excellent pho
data.text: This place is plain and simple. Want  to dine on Vietnamese food where the local Vietnamese choose to dine? This is the place. An excellent place to enjoy authentic varieties of Vietnamese rice noodle soups and assorted Vietnamese cuisine. Inexpensive.

data.title: Friendly service
data.text: We gathered here with a group of friends after a late lunch.  The others ordered pho, which came in great bowls accompanied by plates of fresh greens and sprouts for topping.  My husband and I were still sated so we had spring rolls, which were nothing to write home about.  Still, the company was great, the service friendly, and Anchor Steam was available in bottles, so it was a good time.

data.title: Still the best pho chicken noodle soup
data.text:
This is still the best place in the East Bay for pho chicken noodle soup. The broth cannot be beat anywhere. The chicken is tender sliced white meat / breast.

The barbecued chicken noodle bowl / salad is also amazing.

 Finally , you won't find better spring rolls anywhere, and I mean anywhere. 

Service is good and the staff are ultra friendly. Air temperature inside the restaurant can be a bit warm even though they have air conditioning.

data.title: First time for Vietnamese food!
data.text:
Dropped in late afternoon on a Sunday.  Restaurant got a few more customers after we had been there a short while.  Restaurant was clean and very simple.  Nothing fancy and that was fine with us.  Menu was varied and reasonable.  We found parking behind the restaurant and because it was Sunday, the meters were free.  Otherwise be sure to bring extra change because we saw parking meters all over the place!
 I order the garlic noodles with grilled prawns. Definitely a full plate arrived with a small salad snuggled in corner of plate.  My husband got the white rice with beef.  Obviously neither one of us are risk-takers! 2 Restrooms (separate male & female) with one stall was clean.  Overall the bill came to under $30 including tip & one Heincken beer.

data.title: Fair place if in downtown Alameda
data.text: The place was clean and staff very courteous compared with most Viet restaurants.  They sported a varied menu and the prices were good given the location. Service was fast and we were not disappointed in the quality of the food.  Conveniently located near the cinema and Subpar mini golf as well as an Arcade Museum (pay per hour to play old arcade games!!!!).  A good place to take a break as you enjoy the area.
